datafield.subfield: Institute of Industrial Science, University of Tokyo, Tokyo, 153-8505, Japan
Excitonic, vibrational, and van der Waals interactions in electron energy loss spectroscopy

• Inspired by great achievements by Ondrej L. Krivanek, potentials of EELS for investigations of excitonic interaction, van der Waals interaction, and atomistic vibrational information are present. • Importance of the excitonic calculation and the estimation of the transition energy is presented. • Strong excitonic interaction is found in the oxygen-K edge of perovskite oxides. • Estimation of van der Waals interaction would be possible by combining with ELNES and the suitable ELNES calculation. • Atomistic vibrational information, including molecular vibration and phonon, can be identified using core loss, namely ELNES.
Institute of Industrial Science, University of Tokyo, Tokyo, 153-8505, Japan
Department of Physics, Chemistry and Biology (IFM), Linköping University, Linköping, SE-581 83, Sweden
